title: QOL buff for surrender votes
body:
We all know that it takes four yes votes to surrender. By extension, that means that when two people vote no, the surrender vote won't go through. 

However, the vote stays up until everyone votes if it isn't going to pass. So that allows one person to keep the surrender vote on the screen by not voting, which is a minor distraction.

Make surrender votes go away when two people vote no please.

replies.body: I'd like it if it went away after you cast your vote. It already says in chat the result so you don't need the surrender window blocking part of your screen to let you know if it failed or not.
The "Defeat" screen is kinda hard to miss if it goes through, too.
Or we could make the surrender vote an actual majority and let it go through at 3 to minimise the impact of trolling duo Qs that don't know when to quit.

> [{quoted}](name=AxlStream,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3w2Jz2Uw,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-03-30T04:55:38.205+0000)
>
> Or we could make the surrender vote an actual majority and let it go through at 3 to minimise the impact of trolling duo Qs that don't know when to quit.

No. 3 is too few. I've won a lot of games after a surrender vote barely didn't pass.
Same. In fact, it seems most victories happened after a 3-2 surrender vote lol. People give up so easily in this game....
Of course you did. And team coast totally deserved their LCS spot.

> [{quoted}](name=AxlStream,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3w2Jz2Uw,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-03-30T14:27:51.227+0000)
>
> Of course you did. And team coast totally deserved their LCS spot.

They earned it fair and square. They may have performed terribly once they hit the big stage, but they got in through perfectly legal means. Therefore, they deserved it.

Also, since they defeated other challenger teams in tournament play, we can deduce that those other teams would have done worse in LCS anyways
Oh sure they "made" it. Pretty sure any other team could of had more than a single win though. Ready for the next Coast team to go 0-18 next split.
I hate the trolls who want to put the board up and quit playing just because I'm winning. Sore loser much?
And I hate teams that refuse to close out a game even though it's 2-30 with no objectives lost on their side just because they want to pad their KDAs.
How often do games go that badly though? The problem is people spam surrender votes even when only an ace and a turret behind.

In silver? Often. Just 2 nights ago I had to deal with a team that didn't understand that the enemy Volibear being 7/0/2 and us being unable to 4v1 him was GG. Enemy team proceeded to flail around until 40 minutes while my team insisted on fighting cuz "we can win guyz!!".

About that game: It didn't even last 30 minutes, and it was 14-30 on K/D. You just wanted to put the board up, which is all too common. Maybe you have some games that are "tragic" as you describe, but generally, I've seen more bad sportsmanship than true hopeless situations. Also, Volibear only managed 8 kills, so he didn't really pad that KDA, as suggested.

You were also a frontliner who took similar damage to enemy champions (2 took way more), though they clearly had the damage advantage. That suggests to me that you made an effort to stay out of the fray, as Braum. Yeah, if you don't want to play, you should just not join the game instead of quit in the middle. I can't say you directly trolled in fountain, but you at least sat back and slung Ice Smashes, which is generally useless to the team. I'm surprised they managed 14 kills, especially with a 0-8 Riven top and a satellite Braum.

Correction: I don't actually believe you were satellite Braum anymore. You dealt more physical damage than Cho, and with no AD buffs whatsoever. Instead, I think you quit because team wouldn't surrender. That would explain satellite Cho actually taking more damage than you. This is exactly the problem with the surrender function as a whole. It gives people incentive to up and quit, so that maybe their teammates will put up the board for you because you're being sour.

I exaggerated a bit but point is, I usually know by 20 if the game is winnable or not. Not only because of score but also how you play. The Riven that kept wanting to fight the fed Voli and the failure to kill him 4v1 was enough to call it. Since leaving a match you don't enjoy is not an option, I just tried to farm and pray the enemy would grow some balls to end it.
you could always drag it to the side lol

The thing is, it's already kinda to the side but still distracting. I mean, honestly, there's no point in anyone else voting once 2 people have said no. I wish it would just go away completely once it was a guaranteed failure to surrender. No one elses votes matter.

well, there is a point; making a statement. if the vote fails 4-1, it tells the person who wimped out that nobody thinks they are gonna lose. If it is close, people may consider it next time, but when you see Surrender? Yes-No-No-No-No it lets your team know that you all intend to keep going.
He's saying for example if its Yes-No-No and two people have not voted yet it doesnt matter because there has been 2 no's and the surrender has failed, so it should disappear.
And *he's* saying that it *does* matter because if they vote they're still providing information; how they feel about your chances of success.

Which is cool and all, but when there's just that one person who's trolling with the surrender votes when you're winning, it gets REALLY irritating. I'm pretty sure we've all had that. Besides, I don't know about anyone else, but I try to actually win my games whether other people think we can win or not. Just cuz  1 or 2 people think we can't win doesn't mean we actually can't. If they would just buckle down and actually try, we might just pull a victory out of our asses.
once someone on my team was surrender trolling the entire time. it got to the point that they started a surrender vote when the enemy team's nexus turrets came down

this would be great. 

while we are at it when one person declines a match don't wait for further responses just move on.
Make surrender poll dissapear when you have made the decision. This box is irritating and it feels much larger than it looks ~~just like she said~~

I'm that guy.

The surrender box annoys me, and I almost never surrender, so every time that the thing appears I drag it off the edge of the screen so that I don't have to see it.

The problem there is - now everyone else has to see it for the full duration because I don't see it and can't vote anymore.

I just want a minimize option.

It's simple and fixes all the problems.  Going away after 2 No's, after you vote, or get it to go away if you abstain from voting
It would be nice if they could also minimize it after you vote

I prefer Fried Noob's suggestion: Make it go away after you vote. As he said, you already get the results in chat. I do think knowing the results is important; if its 4-1 no surrender than I feel more confident in my team (since I know they are more confident).

> I prefer Fried Noob's suggestion: Make it go away after you vote. As he said, you already get the results in chat. I do think knowing the results is important; if its 4-1 no surrender than I feel more confident in my team (since I know they are more confident).

It might be just me, but I like seeing how the vote is going. I just don't like the vote staying up after two people have voted no.
Yah a little update to the voting would be nice.
+1. I see no reason not implementing this.

click the corner of the box, drag it off your screen

congratulations, it's gone.
This would so let you got again sooner. I believe the timer starts when the vote completes and not when the vote starts.

Haha i will admit to being one of those players who don't vote. Due to the only fact that it turned into a learning experience. I get to see how others play and i get to focus on the little things like item build, farming, or map awareness(Wards saves lives). And hey you never know sometimes the enemy team rages our you guys catch up and hit that turning point and boom you turn the game and win.
